qas.question: When were the last days of the Dominion of Newfoundland?
What was the result of the 1948 referendum?
What did the Economic Union Party support?
When were the last days of the U.S.-British alliance?
What was the result of the 1940 referendum?
What did the U.S.-British alliance support?
What was a dominion-dependency in the U.S.?

plausible_answers.text: Newfoundland to form an economic union with the United States

qas.question: What was there majority support for?

context: <a0_0><b3_0>In the late 1940s<b3_0/><a0_0/>, during the last days of the <b6_0>Dominion of Newfoundland<b6_0/> (at the time a dominion-dependency in the Commonwealth and independent of Canada), there was mainstream support, although not majority, for <b7_0>Newfoundland to form an economic union with the United States<b7_0/>, thanks to the efforts of the Economic Union Party and significant U.S. investment in Newfoundland stemming from the U.S.-British alliance in World War II. <a1_0><b4_0>The movement ultimately failed<b4_0/><a1_0/> when, in a 1948 referendum, voters narrowly chose to confederate with Canada (the Economic Union Party supported <a2_0><b5_0>an independent "responsible government"<b5_0/><a2_0/> that they would then push toward their goals).
